channel.title: Data by Jonathan K. Kummerfeld
channel.description: Data from the website of Jonathan K. Kummerfeld

item.title: DSTC 7 track 1: Next Utterance Selection
item.description: Data from Noetic End-to-End Response Selection Challenge. Dialogue from Ubuntu tech support and Michigan course advising. https://ibm.github.io/dstc-noesis/public/index.html

item.title: DSTC 8 track 2: Next Utterance Selection
item.description: Data from NOESIS II: Predicting Responses, Identifying Success, and Managing Complexity in Task-Oriented Dialogue. Dialogue from Ubuntu tech support and Michigan course advising. https://github.com/dstc8-track2/NOESIS-II/

item.title: IRC Disentanglement
item.description: Annotation of IRC messages with reply-to structure, which disentangles simultaneous conversations. The largest such annotated resource. https://jkk.name/irc-disentanglement/

item.title: Text to SQL datasets
item.description: A collection of datasets containing questions in English paired with SQL queries for a provided database. Our version homogenises the style of the SQL and corrects errors in previous versions of the data. https://jkk.name/text2sql-data

item.title: IE/NER from Cybercriminal Forums
item.description: Forum posts with annotations of products. https://evidencebasedsecurity.org/forums/#data

item.title: Crowdsourced Paraphrases
item.description: Paraphrases collected while conducting experiments on factors influencing crowd performance. http://aclweb.org/anthology/attachments/P/P17/P17-2017.Datasets.zip

item.title: Spine and Arc version of the Penn Treebank
item.description: Code to convert the standard Penn Treebank into a version where each word is assigned a spine of non-terminals, and arcs to indicate attachments from one spine to another. https://jkk.name/1ec-graph-parser/format-conversion

item.title: Adaptive CCG Supertagging Model
item.description: A model for the C&C supertagger that gives the same results with smaller beam sizes, enabling faster parsing. TODO
